alert.note: Alert for Eastern Lincoln County; Glorieta Mesa Including Glorieta Pass; Lower Rio Grande Valley; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; San Agustin Plains and Adjacent Lowlands; South Central Highlands; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Southwest Mountains; Upper Tularosa Valley (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: High Wind Warning issued March 30 at 11:45AM MDT until March 30 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Southwest winds 35 to 45 mph with gusts up to 65 or 70 mph expected. * WHERE...Northern and Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains, Southwest Mountains, Glorieta Mesa Including Glorieta Pass, Lower Rio Grande Valley, South Central Highlands, Upper Tularosa Valley, Eastern Lincoln County, and San Agustin Plains and Adjacent Lowlands. * WHEN...Until 8 PM MDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Damaging winds could blow down trees and power lines. Power outages are possible. Travel could be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. Blowing dust may cause low visibility on area highways.
info.instruction: Take action to secure trash cans, lawn furniture, and other loose or lightweight outdoor objects. Extremely hazardous driving conditions can be expected, especially for motorists in high profile vehicles who should consider delaying travel.
